objectType.description: The type of the object, enniLocationResponse.

link.description: A link to the ENNI Location.

locationName.description: Name of Data Center or Colocation Facility where NNI is established (i.e., A Location).

enniLocationAddressType.description: Identifies the type of address to be provided for the service location.

enniLocationAddress.description: A site address of the site address type.

link.title: link
link.description: Specifies relationships between the current document and an external resource.

href.description: A URL. Specifies the location of the linked document.

rel.description: Specifies the relationship between the current document and the linked document.

title.description: Provide additional / advisory information (expand on the meaning of the link).

method.description: Specifies how to send the data (e.g. get, post).

type.description: Specifies the media type of the linked document.

formattedAddress.title: formattedAddress
formattedAddress.description: A structured textual way of describing how to find an address, using unformatted strings for the street address.

objectType.description: The type of the object, formattedAddress.

formattedAddressLine1.description: A formatted address line that contains a non-fielded street address.

formattedAddressLine2.description: A formatted address line that contains a non-fielded street address, sub-address (e.g. Suite number), etc.

locality.description: A bounded locality within a city, town or shire principally of urban character.

city.description: City that the address is in.

stateOrProvince.description: The state or province that the address is in.

postcode.description: A descriptor for a postal delivery area, used to speed and simplify the delivery of mail.

postcodeExtension.description: The four-digit extension on an American postal code, what comes after the hyphen when specified.

country.description: The country that the address is in.

fieldedAddress.title: fieldedAddress
fieldedAddress.description: A full representation of an address, as well as geocoding reference for the property.

objectType.description: The type of the object, fieldedAddress.

streetNr.description: Number identifying a specific property on a public street. It may be combined with streetNrLast for ranged addresses.

streetNrSuffix.description: The suffix of the first street number (in a street number range) or the suffix for the street number if there is no range.

streetNrLast.description: Last number in a range of street numbers allocated to an address.

streetName.description: The name of the street or other street type.

streetType.description: The type of street (e.g., Street, St., Road, Rd., Alley).

streetSuffix.description: A modifier denoting a relative direction.

subUnitType.description: The type of subunit (e.g., Flat, Suite, Tower, Unit).

subUnitNr.description: The discriminator used for the subunit, often just a sumple number but may also be a range.

levelType.description: Describes level types within a building (e.g., Floor).

levelNr.description: Used where a level type may be repeated (e.g., BASEMENT 1, BASEMENT 2).

buildingName.description: Allows for buildings with well-known names to be used in an address.

privateStreetName.description: Private streets internal to a property (e.g., a university) with an internal name not recorded by the land title office.

locality.description: A bounded locality within a city, town or shire principally of urban character.

city.description: The city that the address is in.

stateOrProvince.description: The state or province that the address is in.

postcode.description: A descriptor for a postal delivery area, used to speed and simplify the delivery of mail.

postcodeExtension.description: The four-digit extension on an American postal code, what comes after the hyphen when specified.

country.description: The country that the address is in.

geographicPoint.title: geographicPoint
geographicPoint.description: Specifies a particular point on earth based upon geo coding information. Provides the means for quantitative description of the spatial characteristics of features, including dimension, position, size, shape, and orientation. Most commonly used for position (location).

objectType.description: The type of the object, geographicPoint.

latitude.description: Latitude of the point in decimal degrees format.

longitude.description: Longitude of the point in decimal degrees format.

addressReference.title: addressReference
addressReference.description: This represents a reference to an address. The reference should be an address id from an address inventory, a geocoded reference from a geospatial system, etc.

objectType.description: The type of the object, addressReference.

reference.description: The reference can be used to identify an address.
